name: Documents_PutDocument
description:
Adds or replaces a document in an existing draft or in-process envelope.
An in-process envelope is one that has been sent but not yet completed or voided.


**Note:** When adding or modifying documents for an in-process envelope,
DocuSign recommends
[locking the envelope](/docs/esign-rest-api/reference/envelopes/envelopelocks/create/)
prior to making any changes.

To add a new document, set the `documentId` path parameter to a new document ID.

To replace a document, set the `documentId` path parameter to the document ID of the existing document.
The tabs of the original document will be applied to the new document.
For example, a request in cURL looks like this:

```
$ curl --location --request PUT 'https://demo.docusign.net/restapi/v2.1/accounts/0cdb3ff3-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-e43af011006d/envelopes/ea4cc25b-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-a67a0a2a4f6c/documents/1' \
    --header 'Authorization: Bearer eyJ...bqg' \
    --header 'Content-Disposition: filename="newDocument"' \
    --header 'Content-Type: application/pdf' \
    --data-binary '@/location/of/document.pdf'
```

accountId.description: The external account number (int) or account ID GUID.

documentId.description:
The unique ID of the document within the envelope.

Unlike other IDs in the eSignature API,
you specify the `documentId` yourself.
Typically the first document has the ID
`1`, the second document `2`, and so on,
but you can use any numbering scheme
that fits within a 32-bit signed integer
(1 through 2147483647).


Tab objects have a `documentId` property
that specifies the document on which to place
the tab.

$block: This object contains details about the envelope document.

$ul: **addedRecipientIds**: If recipients were added by converting form fields into tabs, their IDs appear here. This property is read-only.
**attachmentTabId**: If this document is an attachment to another document in the envelope, this is the ID of the attachment tab it is associated with on the other document.
**authoritativeCopy**: When **true,** marks all of the documents in the envelope as authoritative copies.
**authoritativeCopyMetadata**: Metadata about a property.
**options**: An array of option strings supported by this setting.
**rights**: Indicates whether the property is editable. Valid values are:
**availableDocumentTypes**:
**containsPdfFormFields**: When **true,** the document has editable form fields that are made available through a PDF format.
**display**: This string sets the display and behavior properties of
**displayMetadata**: Metadata about a property.
**options**: An array of option strings supported by this setting.
**rights**: Indicates whether the property is editable. Valid values are:
**docGenDocumentStatus**:
**docGenErrors**:
**docGenFormFields**:

**documentBase64**: The document's bytes. This field can be used to include a base64 version of the document bytes within an envelope definition instead of sending the document using a multi-part HTTP request. The maximum document size is smaller if this field is used due to the overhead of the base64 encoding.
**documentFields**: An object containing information about the custom fields on the document.
**documentId**: The ID of the document that the tab is placed on. This value must refer to the ID of an existing document.
**documentIdGuid**: The GUID of the document.
**errorDetails**: This object describes errors that occur. It is only valid for responses and ignored in requests.
**errorCode**: The code associated with the error condition.
**message**: A brief message describing the error condition.
**includeInDownload**: When **true,**
**includeInDownloadMetadata**: Metadata about a property.
**options**: An array of option strings supported by this setting.
**rights**: Indicates whether the property is editable. Valid values are:
**isDocGenDocument**:
**name**: The document's file name.
**nameMetadata**: Metadata about a property.
**options**: An array of option strings supported by this setting.
**rights**: Indicates whether the property is editable. Valid values are:
**order**: The order in which to sort the results.
**pages**: An array of page objects that contain information about the pages in the document.
**signerMustAcknowledge**: Sets how the signer interacts with the supplemental document.
**signerMustAcknowledgeMetadata**: Metadata about a property.
**options**: An array of option strings supported by this setting.
**rights**: Indicates whether the property is editable. Valid values are:
**sizeBytes**:
**templateLocked**: When **true,** the sender cannot change any attributes of the recipient. Used only when working with template recipients.
**templateRequired**: When **true,** the sender may not remove the recipient. Used only when working with template recipients.
**type**: The type of this tab. Values are:
**uri**: The URI for retrieving the document.

$block: This object describes errors that occur. It is only valid for responses and ignored in requests.

$ul: **errorCode**: The code associated with the error condition.
**message**: A brief message describing the error condition.
